bee:KeyValue.description: On premise

Local Context - Use this mode to connect to Enovia using the DMP studio agent via OCI. This is more efficient in situations that involve processing an extremely large number of transactions. This mode reduces the load on the HTTP ENOVIA server.
REST - In this mode, you can easily crawl data from the ENOVIA Tomcat server in HTTP Rest mode. It allows you to connect remotely on a CAS-secured instance.
3DSpace - New mode to connect to Enovia through the 3DSpace.
Legacy XML Servlet - Use this mode to connect to Enovia via an XML servlet located on the Enovia server..
Specify the base URL of the 3DSpace | XML Servlet, or leave empty if you use Local Context.
3DSpace | XML Servlet | Local Context user login for indexing documents. Read-access required.
3DSpace | XML Servlet | Local Context password for the ENOVIA user.
Role that can acces ENOVIA.
The vault. If defined, only data related to this vault is indexed. To be used only with 2017x or higher ENOVIA versions.
The Event Monitor is used to detect added/modified/deleted elements, and send their IDs for CloudView updates.

Is it allowed to modifiy the content of the database. For example:
  • If an event monitor is used, then the consumed events will have to be purged out of the database, this requires a write access.
    • If the FCS is a remote FCS, then file synchronization information wil have to be updated, this requires a write access.
  • ...
The tenant
The path to the query configuration file

Select an item processor. This is typically useful to get rid of items you don't want to index. Using a processor allows you to go further than using Include/Exclude? policies as you can customize it to your own needs.
Project Based Security
The 3DSpace prefix, used to diferentiate 3DSpaces for project based security only.
Hidden component filter class name

If no security token is generated, adds the Everybody token which makes the document visible to everyone. This option has no effect if a security token is generated by any security handler, this one included.

If no security token is generated, adds the Everybody token which makes the document visible to everyone. This option has no effect if a security token is generated by any security handler, this one included.
Advanced config
Number of documents pushed into Push API Server before a checkpoint is pushed. A low value may lead to inefficient Push API multithreading
If checked the connector will connect to ENOVIA on apply configuration
Number of threads used to push data into the CloudView? Push API Server. It is useful when converting documents using PushAPI filters.
Size of the queue used to push data into the CloudView? Push API Server.
Useful to debug the connector configuration. Logs each event sent to the CloudView? Push API. For internal use by Support teams only.
Number of threads used by Query or Vault Tenant Producers.

Chooses the scna strategy:
  • Query - For on premise deployment. All the Queries are executed in parallel on tenant after the other.
  • Tenant - For cloud deployment. the same Query is executed in parallel on every tenant, one query after the other.
  • Event - For frequent scans with little changes on the DB. All The events are retrieved from the monitor specified in the connectivity, all the entities which correspond to one of the query are feteched.

Each time a scan is started, looks for changes in the data-model. This is a costly operation which shan't be used unless you know your data-model undergoes regular changes. Do not use it if the data-model changes rarely or does not change at all
Graphs will be managed as they were when using the legacy SBA connector (URIs and Consolidation Server object graph will be treated as they were using the old SBA connector).
The standard fields used to create URIs
If checked connector will generate consolidation box graph
If checked deletes will be supported not only for id uri member (EXPERIMENTAL does not feet for huge datas volume)
If checked and multitenant connector then URIs will be prefixed by <tenant_id>/
The date time pattern for date fields
The custom fields
Configuration the way the arcs generated by a path are named
Appends the name of the destination type to the name of the link between path's element and their destination
Options when doing incremental scan process. These options do not apply when using an {@code Event Monitor}.
The number of minutes to add to the last modified date checkpoint.

The number of seconds between 2 consecutive scans. If the previous scan happened before this duration, then a partial ordering over the modified date is done, else this is a strict ordering.
  • Negative value disables the partial ordering
  • 0 forces the partial ordering
  • Positive value gives the duration in seconds such as:
    • Tn - Tn-1 ≤ this value, the where clause for query indexation is such modified ≥ previous checkpoint.
    • Tn - Tn-1 > this value, the where clause for query indexation is such modified > previous checkpoint.
Options for the delete process. These options do not apply when using an {@code Event Monitor}.
The number of minutes to add to the last delete checkpoint.
If false, for every query which has a where clause, the contrapositive of the clause is run. Every returned entry is deleted. If true no contrapositive where clause is run.
Project the datamodel in the consolidation box
For every sent attribute, also sends the dimension linked to the attribute. Only the dimensions of the sent attributes are present.
Draw arcs from business objects to the type it refers. It requires this configuration to send types to the consolidation box.
Draw arcs from connection to relationship type it refers. It requires this configuration to send relationships to the consolidation box.
Draw arcs from business object or connection to interface types it refers. It requires this configuration to send interfaces to the consolidation box.

Manages the retry on error for Business Objects and Connecions when these are retrieved from the Enovia database. It does not handle errors that would occur afterwards to the document (eg: a faultly PushAPI filter or Consolidation box error)

The maximum number of consecutives fetch retrieval errors a single object can trigger before being ignored. Every retry is done only once for the couple Query X Object the following scan, provided the query which fetched the object is still present. A value of:
  • Below 0 means that there is no upper limit. The entity will be attempted to be fetched as long as it exists and there is a query corresponding to it.
  • 0 means that no retry is ever done. Every error is discarded.
  • Above 0 is the number of retries. When this threshold is reached, an error log is emitted and the entity will not be retried at the next scan.
Note that if a Business Object for example fails that number of times, but at a further scan matches the where clause, the cycle will restart anew.

The admissible maximum of errors for a single scan. Once this threshold is met, the connector raises an error. A value of:
  • Below 0 means that there is no limit in the number of errors for this scan run
  • 0 means that the first error met should disrupt the scan. This is equivalent to not enable the retry on error.
  • Above 0 is the number of errors accepted for this scan run.
It is an indicative counter.
